detaileddescription.para: node comparator for best lower bound

memberdef.argsstring: (SCIP_NODE *node, SCIP_VAR **branchvars, SCIP_Real *branchbounds, SCIP_BOUNDTYPE *boundtypes, int *nbranchvars, int branchvarssize)
memberdef.name: SCIPnodeGetParentBranchings

briefdescription.para: array of variables on which the branching has been performed in the parent node
array of bounds which the branching in the parent node set
array of boundtypes which the branching in the parent node set
number of variables on which branching has been performed in the parent node if this is larger than the array size, arrays should be reallocated and method should be called again

detaileddescription.para: returns the set of variable branchings that were performed in the parent node to create this node

memberdef.argsstring: (SCIP_NODE *node, SCIP_VAR **branchvars, SCIP_Real *branchbounds, SCIP_BOUNDTYPE *boundtypes, int *nbranchvars, int branchvarssize)
memberdef.name: SCIPnodeGetAncestorBranchings

briefdescription.para: array of variables on which the branchings has been performed in all ancestors
array of bounds which the branchings in all ancestors set
array of boundtypes which the branchings in all ancestors set
number of variables on which branchings have been performed in all ancestors if this is larger than the array size, arrays should be reallocated and method should be called again

detaileddescription.para: returns the set of variable branchings that were performed in all ancestor nodes (nodes on the path to the root) to create this node
outputs the path into given file stream in GML format

memberdef.argsstring: (SCIP_NODE *node, SCIP_VAR **branchvars, SCIP_Real *branchbounds, SCIP_BOUNDTYPE *boundtypes, int *nbranchvars, int branchvarssize, int *nodeswitches, int *nnodes, int nodeswitchsize)
memberdef.name: SCIPnodeGetAncestorBranchingPath

briefdescription.para: array of variables on which the branchings has been performed in all ancestors
array of bounds which the branchings in all ancestors set
array of boundtypes which the branchings in all ancestors set
number of variables on which branchings have been performed in all ancestors if this is larger than the array size, arrays should be reallocated and method should be called again

marks, where in the arrays the branching decisions of the next node on the path start; branchings performed at the parent of node always start at position 0. For single variable branching, nodeswitches[i] = i holds
number of nodes in the nodeswitch array
available slots in node switch array

detaileddescription.para: returns the set of variable branchings that were performed in all ancestor nodes (nodes on the path to the root) to create this node sorted by the nodes, starting from the current node going up to the root
checks for two nodes whether they share the same root path, i.e., whether one is an ancestor of the other
finds the common ancestor node of two given nodes
gets the type of the node
gets successively assigned number of the node
gets the depth of the node
gets the lower bound of the node
gets the estimated value of the best feasible solution in subtree of the node
gets the domain change information of the node, i.e., the information about the differences in the variables domains to the parent node
gets the parent node of a node in the branch-and-bound tree, if any
returns whether node is in the path to the current node
returns whether the node is marked to be propagated again

briefdescription.para: public methods for branch and bound tree
